text.section: In this section, "emergency management and civil defense" and "emergency" have the meanings stated in the State Emergency Management and Civil Defense Act.

No action for damages may be brought against a person, firm, or corporation who allows premises which he owns, controls, or occupies to be used, free of charge, for one of the following purposes:
Sheltering persons during an attack or raid by an enemy;
Stocking of food, water, medical supplies, equipment, or other materials to be used in the event of an attack upon the United States; or
Sheltering persons during an emergency.
